definition[0]: a track with very steep slopes and curves, which people ride on in small carriages at fairs and amusement parks
example[0]: Their relationship was an emotional roller coaster.
definition[2]: when there are large up and down movements in the prices of shares, currencies etc within a short period of time
example[1]: After a roller-coaster day, the dollar was down against the pound but up moderately against the yen.
